ygData.subject: Re: Which song for soloing?
ygData.msgSnippet: Here s Geoffrey Zatkin s response to that very question.  In case you don t know, Geoffrey is Verant s Spell GM, the one who makes them all, implements ...
ygData.messageBody:
Here's Geoffrey Zatkin's response to that very question. In case you don't
know, Geoffrey is Verant's Spell GM, the one who makes them all, implements
them, tunes them, etc.:




| View Thread | Post Response | Return to Index | Read Prev Msg | Read
Next Msg |


[EverQuest Beta] Magic Board

Re: I think that would be fairly crippling
Posted By: Geoffrey Z. <gzatkin@...>
Wednesday, 5 May 1999, at 4:46 p.m.

In Response To: I think that would be fairly crippling (Kuur)

Bards have been balanced to multiple songs.

----- Original Message -----
From: John Kim <kim@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, May 14, 1999 3:38 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Which song for soloing?


>From: John Kim <kim@...>
>
>On Thu, 13 May 1999, Snicker wrote:
>>
>> I wasn't aware that the warsong gave a speed bonus - in fact, in my
>> comparisons (I use scarabs as my "baseline") with no bonus, I hit less
>> often than the creature I'm fighting, with the Warsong, it's the same,
but
>> the Anthem puts me at equal-to or faster. Pretty sweet if you ask me.
>
>I'll run the tests again to double-check. What level were you
>when you ran this test? I wouldn't be surprised if the
>speedup for one or both were dependent on level/skill.
>
>> In regards to stacking, I had someone point out that this might be
>> considered "abuse" - what are your thoughts?
>
>I'd like to hear an official stance on it. I heard someone
>claim that Brad himself said it was OK, but have yet to verify
>that.
>
>--
>John H. Kim
>kim@...
>
>
